hi.  I need to increase my crawl rate on some hosts that I have permission=
 to crawl quickly.  
The fastest I can get the crawl to go right now is 5 d=
ocs/second, with maximum "impoliteness" (delayFactor=3D0.0, maxDelayMs=3D0,=
 minDelayMs=3D0).  This is not quick enough for my needs.
I'm assuming the =
bottleneck is this limitation:    "It is important to note that at any give=
n time only one URI from any given host is processed."      -- from: https:=
//webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Frontier+Settings
I'm hoping th=
at others have thought of a way to workaround or ideally remove the "1-URI-=
at-a-time" restriction from Heritrix.
BTW, I dug through the archives and f=
ound this thread:  http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/messa=
ge/2933
However, the suggested solution of writing my own QueueAssignmentPo=
licy, and handling prerequisite problems, seems a little involved for me.So=
 I'm wondering if in the last 3.5 years this has become easier to accomplis=
h.I'm hopeful that this statement from Gordon Mohr on that thread was presc=
ient and the "multiple simultaneous URIs" option has returned:
   (An earli=
er frontier implementation had an option for processing multiple URLs from =
a single queue/host at once, but the option was not carried
    forward to =
the current recommended frontier implementation.  It may return as an optio=
n in a future version.)
I eagerly await your replies, Thanks!
-Erik 		 	   =
